intro: Columbaria suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented columbaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that emit a pleasant, fragrant aroma. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Columbaria suaveolens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
